poem:
Title: "A Warming Christmas Tale"

Ordinary ornaments drooping,
as the last snowman wept sweat.
Woolen sweaters lie forgotten,
Warm greetings ride 15.3C heatwave,
carving yuletide stories on air.
Bullfinches gargle merry songs,
winter's coat now a light vest;
Across the UK, heat hums secrets,
Christmas Eve's sun-kissed affair.
Laughter melts in mildness,
a tale from '97, reborn.
